intro: Aneilema scaberrimum, commonly known as the rough aneilema, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its robust, herbaceous stems and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, bell-shaped flowers that are typically white or pale blue in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it prefers humid conditions to flourish.
